greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array read by rows: see Comments for definition.
comment: Form the square array in which row m satisfies r(0) = r(1) = 1; r(n) = m*r(n-1) + r(n-2):
Now form a triangle by taking the first k terms of column k:
mathematica: f[n_Integer] = Module[{a}, a[n] /. RSolve[{a[n] == m*a[n - 1] + a[n - 2], a[0] == 1, a[1] == 1}, a[n], n][[1]] // FullSimplify] a = Table[Table[Rationalize[N[f[n], 100], 0], {m, 1, n}], {n, 1, 10}] Flatten[a]
results.author: _Roger L. Bagula_ and _Gary W. Adamson_, Sep 09 2006
ext: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 02 2008
